intro: Thermopsis yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan thermopsis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of yellow, pea-like flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in alpine flora.
